title: What are some 'only in Greece' moments? - Quora

response.answer_text: Q. What are some "only in Greece" moments? I was backpacking through the Aegean Islands with my Greek-Aussie investment banker mate.  We came across an old Greek man, sitting on a rock, sipping a glass of Ouzo, staring at the sun setting into the sea. There were olive trees growing on the hills behind the old Greek, untended. Olives just dropped all over the ground.   My pal: To whom do the trees belong to? Man: They’re mine. My pal: Don’t you gather the olives? Man: I just pick one when I want one. My pal (the biz animal): But, don’t you realize that if you pruned the trees, and picked the olives at their peak, you could sell them? You know that everybody is crazy about extra virgin olive oil, and they pay damned good price for it. Man: What would I do with the money? My pal: You could build yourself a big house, and hire servants to do everything for you. Man: And then what would I do? My pal: Anything you want! Man: You mean, like sit outside, and sip ouzo at sunset?
